release_notes.en-US:
* Fixes automatically closing a tab when deleting a message that is the only one displayed in the tab.
* Minor improvements and preparations for future work.

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
3.0.10:

* Fixes an issue where right-clicking on attachments and selecting open/save/detach/delete would not work.
* Fixes an issue where an attachment name couldn't be selected, and improves click to preview area of attachments.
* Fixes an issue where messages may not be displayed correctly.

3.x series:

* Rewritten the UI under-the-hood. Improved performance and future maintainability.
* Fixes the contact popup moving on first click.
* First run setup assistant is now loaded as a tab.
* Fixes compatibility up to 72.

Known issues

* Quick Reply is still disabled

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
3.0.6:

* Fixes an issue where double-clicking to open a message in a new tab or window would not work.
* Fixes an issue where selecting the compose button in the contact popup would not work.

3.x series:

* Rewritten the UI under-the-hood. Improved performance and future maintainability.
* Fixes the contact popup moving on first click.
* First run setup assistant is now loaded as a tab.
* Fixes compatibility up to 72.

Known issues

* Quick Reply is still disabled
* Opening conversation in a new tab will not re-expand the messages to the same state they were previously.

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
* Rewritten the UI under-the-hood. Improved performance and future maintainability.
* Fixes the contact popup moving on first click.
* Fixes an issue where uninstall may not be fully completed.
* First run setup assistant is now loaded as a tab.
* Fixes compatibility up to 72.

Known issues

* Quick Reply is still disabled

release_notes.en-US: * Fixes an issue where the pdf preview was not working.

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
* Fixes adding/editing contacts from the contact popup in the email view.
* Fixes an issue which could cause messages to not be displayed at all if Thunderbird could not identify the default account.
* Fixes forwarding a conversation to display the complete messages.

release_notes.en-US: * Fix display of tags.

release_notes.en-US:
* Preferences UI now re-enabled in Thunderbird 68.

Known issues:

* Quick reply is currently disabled as it needs more work for Thunderbird 68.

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US: * Fixes saving and opening of some attachments * Fixes detaching a conversation to a new window/tab. Known issues: * Quick reply is currently disabled as it needs more work for Thunderbird 68. * Preferences display is currently not working due to a addons.thunderbird.net issue.

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
* Fixes an issue where a message might not be displayed probably if it hadn't yet been indexed.

Known issues:

* Quick reply is currently disabled as it needs more work for Thunderbird 68.
* Opening/saving of attachments might not work correctly (Workaround: Use the classic view available from the three-dot menu).

text.en-US: This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

release_notes.en-US:
Recent fixes:

* Fix display of email address when hovering over a contact that has a card in the address book.
* When displaying a message in the classic reader with remote content, the preferences button for the remote content will be displayed.

Known issues:

* Quick reply is currently disabled as it needs more work for Thunderbird 68.

release_notes.en-GB:
* Removed some redundant code
* Upgraded license version to MPL 2.0 (also smaller files!)
* Stopped double-logging to the error console.
release_notes.en-US:
* Removed some redundant code for aligning attachments.
* Upgraded license to MPL 2.0 (also: smaller files!).
* Stopped double logging messages to the error console.

release_notes.en-US:
* Add support for Thunderbird 57/58.
* Fix allowing remote content per email address in Thunderbird 52 and later.
* Fix reverting folder views when the add-on is uninstalled.

release_notes.en-US:
• Now includes support for Thunderbird 52.
  • Fixes handling of duplicate youtube links.
  • Fixes some key handling issues - Select All (ctrl/cmd-A) is now interpreted correctly, rather than as Archive
  • Various Layout Improvements.
Note: This version might not work properly in Thunderbird 57 and later (fixes coming soon).

release_notes.en-US:
This release fixes some minor issues such as:
- fix attachments not showing with pgp/mime
- theme issues on Windows
- some mails did not display
- gallery view was broken
- email addresses in the CC field were mixed up on reply-all.

This release has been supported by contributors, so many thanks to: Artem Bozhenov, Chris Lajoie, Hiroshi Shirosaki, Paul Stöcker for their numerous bugfixes.

release_notes.en-US:
What's happened.
- Huge cleanup and heroic fixes following deprecations / breakages in the Mozilla codebase (Paul Stöcker).
- Conversations should integrate properly into dark themes (Tobias Bengfort).

release_notes.en-US: This release brings several new improvements. New features. - The address for replying can now be changed in the quick reply. - The "quick reply" feature now uses an HTML editor (#369), meaning that no loss of formatting occurs when replying. The message will be sent as HTML only if necessary (just like the regular composition process). This fixes several other issues related to signatures (#353, #644, #779). The hidden, unsupported compose-in-a-tab feature provided by this addon hence also uses HTML composition. - New "open" action for attachments added to a quick-reply. - The "open messages in: a new window" preference (in Advanced > Reading and Display) is now honored. This means that you can open a conversation in a separate window by flipping this preference and double-clicking on a message in the thread pane, or hitting the "pop out" button in the conversation toolbar. - Support for the DKIM verifier addon. - Option to always collapse signatures. Bugfixes. - Fix the Lightning plugin support. - Contact tooltips now display properly even when the message is collapsed. - The addon no longer waits for images to load before reflowing and adjusting the height of a message. - Several other bugfixes related to changes in Thunderbird. Help wanted! - I don't expect to have much time in the upcoming few months. If you wish to see a feature implemented, please feel free to have a look at the code and send pull requests!

release_notes.en-US:
This is a temporary version with no translations until I manage to issue a proper version. There are numerous improvements:
- html in quick reply,
- fixes numerous issues with signatures,
- conversations now open in separate windows, hence respecting user preferences,
- compatibility with the dkim verifier addon,
- numerous fixes for Thunderbird 31.0 compatibility

release_notes.en-US:
This is more of a maintenance release, there's no new features.
- Fixes for compatibility with recent Gecko releases.
- Usual round of fixes for PGP/MIME.
- Cleanups.
- Updates to the bundled PDF.js version.

I really lack time to improve the addon, so any help will be appreciated. There are some easy bugs to fix on the github page, feel free to submit pull requests. Thanks.

release_notes.en-US:
New version! There are a few new features:

- The addon is now restartless.
- New (unsupported) compose in a tab feature. Use Ctrl-Shift-N to trigger.
- Many bugfixes for recent changes that happened on Thunderbird trunk.
- Improvements to the "forward this conversation" feature.
- Fixed an issue where the gallery view didn't work.
- Fixed an issue where the composition fields were wrong when using the quick reply.

I don't have that much time available for maintaining the addon right now, so if anyone feels like contributing, there's easy JS / CSS fixes that even beginners can tackle!

release_notes.en-US:
- Add a context menu to detach/delete attachments.
- Add the ability to add attachments using the quick reply feature.
- Add support for the "background send" feature in the quick reply.
- Fix lightning integration.
- Many, many fixes and improvements for Enigmail support.
- Fixes in attachment names.
- Be compatible with the "remember selected message" pref.
- Many, many other bug fixes.

release_notes.en-US:
- Add a context menu to detach/delete attachments.
- Add the ability to add attachments using the quick reply feature.
- Add support for the "background send" feature in the quick reply.
- Fix lightning integration.
- Many, many fixes and improvements for Enigmail support.
- Fixes in attachment names.
- Be compatible with the "remember selected message" pref.
- Many, many other bug fixes.
